diseaseDescription: Caused by various fungal pathogens (e.g. Cercospora angreci, Septoria selenophomoides), leaf spots begin as yellowish lesions and progress to brown or black necrotic areas, reducing photosynthesis and overall vigor.

culturalCare.title: Reduce Leaf Wetness
steps: Avoid overhead watering and prevent prolonged moisture on leaves
Ensure good air circulation around the foliage
Quarantine new or visibly affected plants

culturalCare.title: Sanitation
steps: Remove and dispose of infected leaves using sterile tools
Clean tools between cuts to avoid spread
Remove fallen debris around the plant

chemicalControl.title: Fungicide Applications
steps: Use a fungicide labeled for leaf spot diseases

ecoFriendly.title: Cinnamon or Natural Antifungal
steps: Apply a light dusting of cinnamon powder to spot-cleaned areas
Use as a natural barrier where practical
